title: Trading Perpetuals on Orbit Markets
description: Explore Orbit Markets, a decentralized perpetual futures protocol built on Aptos that enables traders to access leveraged trading with deep liquidity and advanced risk management systems.

tasks.title: Prepare for Trading
tasks.description: Add at least 0.1 APT to your wallet to explore Orbit Markets' trading platform

tasks.title: Perpetual Futures Basics
tasks.description: Understand what perpetual futures contracts are
tasks.question: What is a perpetual futures contract?
options: A contract that expires at a specific date
A futures contract with no expiry date that can be held indefinitely
A spot trade with immediate delivery
A bond with fixed interest payments
tasks.correctAnswer: A futures contract with no expiry date that can be held indefinitely

tasks.title: Orbit Markets Overview
tasks.description: Learn about Orbit Markets' core offering
tasks.question: What is the main product offered by Orbit Markets?
options: Spot trading only
Decentralized perpetual futures trading
Options contracts
Physical commodity delivery

tasks.title: Leverage Trading
tasks.question: What does trading with leverage mean on Orbit Markets?
options: Borrowing assets to increase potential returns and risk
Using special trading tools
Trading only when market prices are high
Trading with multiple accounts simultaneously
tasks.correctAnswer: Borrowing assets to increase potential returns and risk

tasks.title: Funding Rate
tasks.question: What is the funding rate in perpetual futures trading?
options: The interest rate for borrowing assets
The platform's transaction fee
A periodic payment between long and short traders that keeps perpetual prices aligned with the index price
The rate at which new tokens are minted
tasks.correctAnswer: A periodic payment between long and short traders that keeps perpetual prices aligned with the index price

tasks.title: Liquidations
tasks.description: Understanding risk management in leveraged trading
tasks.question: What is a liquidation in the context of Orbit Markets?
options: Converting cryptocurrencies to stablecoins
The forced closure of a position when it doesn't meet margin requirements
Removing liquidity from a pool
Selling an entire portfolio at once
tasks.correctAnswer: The forced closure of a position when it doesn't meet margin requirements

tasks.title: Liquidity Pools
tasks.description: Learning about the market structure of Orbit
tasks.question: How is liquidity provided on Orbit Markets?
options: Only by the Orbit team
Through a central limit order book only
By liquidity providers who deposit assets into pools and earn fees
Through direct peer-to-peer lending
tasks.correctAnswer: By liquidity providers who deposit assets into pools and earn fees

tasks.title: Position Sizing
tasks.description: Understanding risk management as a trader
tasks.question: Why is position sizing important when trading on Orbit Markets?
options: It doesn't matter as long as you have enough collateral
To manage risk by limiting exposure relative to your total portfolio
Only to qualify for trading rewards
Only to avoid platform fees
tasks.correctAnswer: To manage risk by limiting exposure relative to your total portfolio

tasks.title: Available Markets
tasks.description: Learning about tradable assets on Orbit
tasks.question: What types of markets are typically available on Orbit Markets?
options: Only APT perpetuals
Only stablecoin pairs
Major cryptocurrencies, forex pairs, and commodities
Only traditional stocks
tasks.correctAnswer: Major cryptocurrencies, forex pairs, and commodities

tasks.title: Platform Security
tasks.question: What security features does Orbit Markets implement?
options: No specific security measures
Code audits, insurance funds, and proper risk parameters
Only reliance on Aptos blockchain security
Only manual review of large trades
tasks.correctAnswer: Code audits, insurance funds, and proper risk parameters

tasks.title: Order Types
tasks.description: Learning about trading options on Orbit
tasks.question: What order types does Orbit Markets typically support?
options: Only market orders
Only limit orders
Market, limit, stop-loss, and take-profit orders
Only conditional orders
tasks.correctAnswer: Market, limit, stop-loss, and take-profit orders
